page.title: 11RELIGION IN HALE BARNS.
page.content: Of all the places of worship in this Survey area it is peculiar that those of Hale Barns are situated so close together; typical of the ecumenical spirit of the age. One group decided to find out about the oldest foundation ; that of{Hale Unitarian {Chapel}in Chapel Lane. The caretaker told them that it was built in l723 as {"The Presbyterian Meeting House"}to house the dissenting congregation that was dispossesed of their occupancy of Ringway Chapel. The chapel is notable for its box pews and its fine pulpit with sounding board. The congregation pioneered education in the district and provided its first day school in l740. This building is on Hale Road adjacent to the Unicorn Hotel. These old, listed, buildings add character to the suburb and are a proud symbol of an active congregation.
